elements.title: dancing pallbearers in Suriname (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that there is an annual holiday for dancing pallbearers in Suriname (examples pictured)?

elements.title: Issy Bailey (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when Paralympian Issy Bailey was in Stoke Mandeville Hospital, she had so many injuries that shooting seemed to be the best option?

elements.title: Zuijin Teiki Emaki (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Zuijin Teiki Emaki, a 13th-century Japanese painted handscroll, presents nine equestrian portraits of some of the Imperial Guards who protected the Daijō Tennō?

elements.title: Nova Iriansyah (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nova Iriansyah, the governor of Aceh, was expelled from elementary school as a child?

elements.title: Metropolitan Tower (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when the 68-story Metropolitan Tower in New York City was being built, its developer was forced to stop marketing it as a 78-story building?

elements.title: Kangmei Pharmaceutical (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Kangmei Pharmaceutical's financial fraud was initially described as an "accounting error"?

elements.title: William McAndrew (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that William McAndrew, the superintendent of Chicago Public Schools, was accused of being an agent of George V, King of the United Kingdom?

elements.title: Beautiful Boys (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Yoko Ono's song "Beautiful Boys" incorporates sound effects from the first Star Wars film?
